attributes.action: introduce legislation to abolish the Privy Council, handing its powers to the House of Commons.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The Privy Council is made up of Ministers and is not accountable to parliament.  It can make laws called 'Orders in Council'.

Laws made under orders in council have the same force as primary legislation but are not scrutinised by parliament and do not have to comply with constitutional checks such as the Human Rights Act.
